ratings.comment: Shes useless, dont take it with her unless you need to. Her lecture notes are straight out of the book and her lectures are terrible. Exams unpredictable because she loves putting random material that you dont expect on there. Simple advice: memorize, memorize, memorize, if you memorize her lecture notes you should do fine, thats what I did.

Boring lectures but pay attention because all material is strictly from lectures. Do book problems...a lot of exam questions are similar to her suggested practice problems. If you have any questions just ask her and she will clarify. Also, ALWAYS check your exams when you get them back...I got all three exams scores raised due to summation errors.
Great Prof, lectures boring as hell, but concise.  She tells you everything you will need to know.  Best of all, her curves are set at the B, just show up to lecture, and you'll pass

Lectures are poorly organized and do not flow, which makes it very hard to learn.  She's one of the least well spoken professors I've met. I sat in on another lecturer because of this.  If you want to learn, find a tutor and learn the book. I would recommend Dr. Clauss or Dr. Gellman.
Sweet lady, but super hard exams! I thought the first exam was going to be a piece of cake and got screwed over on that deal. Curves are forgiving.

Really good professor. If you read the book before lecture, you see that her lectures are very well organized and clear. Of course there is a lot of pointless memorizing and it's not a thrilling or exciting class, it's o-chem! But probably the best o-chem professor you could get.

Barb is a wonderful lady and definitely has a knack for teaching ochem. I had Gellman for 343 and compared to him, her lectures are incredibly slow. That said, I think by the end of the semester we covered an equivalent amount of material, and I understood it more in lecture. Studied notes, did a couple book problems, read through text once, got B.

Had her for 343 and 345.  Going to office hours (which I did multiple times) was a complete waste of time.  The worst part is she gives almost no material to practice with. The reviews and homework are not even close to the test. Her classic answer to any question "Go look it up in the book." I can't recommend enough to take it with someone else.
Shes terrible. Absolutely useless lectures and material that you have to laboriously memorize to no end.

I cant imagine taking anyone else but barb for ochem. The class is curved heavily. Self teaching out of the book is a must, but that goes for any ochem class. After reading the book, her notes are crystal clear and really helpful. As long as you do that, it would be very difficult to get a bad grade.

Barb is very concise both in conversation and in teaching style.  Read the book, do the problems, and study your notes (know mechanisms, intermediates, nomenclature, and reagents) GOOD LUCK!  Its not too bad, the curve is forgiving

Ochem is going to be tough no matter who your prof is.  Barb lectured slowly, which was nice because you never missed anything but could also be boring.  Her homework was useful, but exam questions were 10 times harder than anything in homework, lecture or book.  She also stayed to answer questions after lecture and was helpful in office hour.

I think barb is the prof of choice for ochem. it may seem her lectures are hard to follow, but that is because it is all new material. actually if you look back at your notes, her lectures do make sense, a lot of sense. obviously ochem is going to take some effort and this includes both lecture AND book, but honeslty, what did you expect?

Chem 343 with Whitlock is one of the harder OChem classes on campus. Especially if you've never had OChem before. The class goes very fast and although she is willing to help you in office hours, class is still very confusing. Tests much harder than the practice tests she posts online. If you have her, try and get a tutor!!!

This is a hard class no matter who you take it with, but I would not reccommend her unless you are amazing at learning everything from the book. She is a nice old lady, but I didn't understand a word she said until I went home and studied the books for a few hours afterwords. Tests are pretty hard, but the curve really helps.

Had her for 343 and 345 back in the day and LOVED it...  She was arguably one of my favorite professors ever...  Lectures were really clear and she was always available outside of class for clarification...  If you do the problem sets and the practice exams you should be able to get an A...  Taking O-chem with her was a privilege...

I had her both semesters and she was a lot harder for 345 than 343. What is on the exams is often not emphasized in class, which is really annoying, so you have to read the book. She is really boring and lectures way too slowly

I went to her office hours, hired a tutor, and she even knew me by name,but I just didn't get her teaching style. I failed the class, and she refused to give me a D even though she knew I gave the effort. Try to avoid her.

She is very boring and her lectures are torture at times.  The only reason I went to lecture was so that I'd know what parts of the book I should read.  If you learn via the book and do problems you'll be fine, but it won't be enjoyable.  She tends to waste half the time going over useless information like naming compounds and synthesizing drugs

After two semester with Barb, I can honestly say that I enjoyed O.Chem. Her tests are hard in 345, but the curve is always helpful. Get your hands on some old exams. She repeats questions quite frequently it seems. She prob doesn't teach you the most, but if you put in the time to fully understand her notes and form a study group, you'll succeed.

Many of us were very successful by not paying attention in class (just copying); reading the book and doing the book problems the weekend before the test is key! If you can get your hands on old tests, they are extremely helpful. She utilizes the same ideas in all of her tests. A was usually around 75-80. Much better than others I have heard about.
Take her for O chem if you can. She's a pretty good lecturer...a little sassy at time when ppl ask questions, but overall worth taking

Be prepared to read the book after lecture. It is probably the best way with Dr. Whitlock because she doesn't always cover all topics in each chapter. Tests are difficult and require good knowledge of sterochem. Always one or two problems that you don't know how to do it until you stare at it for a while (synth. or story problems). 75-80% for an A.
a nice lady. she does care about you. not so good with regrades but whatever cuz the curve is awesome.

She was a very nice lady who did a decent job explaining the material. She would sometimes get a little confused, but not too bad. Her exams were a little tough, but fair if you studied. Overall she was better then all of the other O chem teachers, from what I hear at least.

She is such a grandma. not the best, but all right, I'm glad I had her instead of Reich. She's nice, but she talks pretty slow and it gets quite dull at the beginning because she does a lot of review.

Whitlock was a great choice, at least in comparison with other profs.  Her lectures are well organized, clear, and concise. Homework isn't too difficult, but for sure useful. Exams are challenging, but fair and text on application of material. Know your mechanisms and what reagents do!!! Having a good chemical arsenal is important!

Barb is a good choice. Super helpful in office hours, her exams are strikingly like the ones from the semester before (not the practice exams) - so try to get a hold of someones old midterms. She is hilariously awkward, but really knows what she's doing, and cares to help you. She's not trying to kill you. I'd recommend her

Really nice old lady who clearly cares about her students.  The concepts she explains, she explains well.  But then she goes and asks you ridiculously hard exam questions that she never taught you how to answer.  I took her because people said I would "actually learn something" as opposed to Zimmerman where you just get an A.  I'd rather take the A

Her tests are deceivingly hard for how little she teaches in lecture.  She's really awkard and makes jumpy movements which makes lecture fun sometimes.  No quizzes, but gives homework.  Take Zimmerman if you can...

I loved Grandma B! She was crystal clear in her lecture style and it was obvious she wanted us to understand the material and do well, and was willing to help us do just that. The exams were mild, comparitavely speaking, and no quizzes! The homeworks were pretty easy and often times problems from them showed up on the exams.

Whitlock is GREAT!  I love this prof.  I had her for both 343 and 345.  She may seem to go slow, but she teaches you only what you need to know.  Her tests are extremely fair.  She's by far the lesser of the evils for ochem profs.  And she gives easy homework worksheets, which means NO quizzes.

She's very organized with her lectures. You don't have quizes, just 5 homeworks, 3 exams and the final. The final has some review of the first 3 exams. Her lectures can be boring but looking over the notes, reading the chapters and doing the assigned problems helped me do well on her exams.

She was one of the worst teachers I've ever had.  The lectures were super boring and taught almost nothing, and the tests were incredibly hard.  If that's what you are into...then she's your gal I guess.

Barb got me through the lectures and went nice and slow and was always open to questions (if she spotted your hand). Exams were really hard for me... pretty sure I put magic over one of the arrows for a reaction mechanism...

Not too bad. Her lectures feel disorganized sometimes, but she will thoroughly go through all the material that ends up on exams. Exams themselves will require some creativity- memorization alone won't give you an A.

Class wasn't as bad as I expected.  There was almost no homework so the workload was light other than exam studying. exams were challenging but not tricky.  if you prepare well they are fine.  class is organized and runs at a good pace.  whitlock does a good job.

If you don't really care for chemistry or the lecturers who whiz through material at lightning speed, Barb is the lady for you. She'll answer all your questions and be very clear about everything she tells you. Wonderful professor...
No Comments

She's honestly not that bad. Her lectures are organize and yeah she makes a few mistakes in lectures but overall her teaching style is fine. Her exams aren't too bad either; she hands out a practice exam that provides a general idea of what to expect.
She Cute Quiet. The first test is simple, the others hard.

Ah, I love Grandma B! She takes the time to make sure you are following what she is teaching and the tests are quite reasonable. If you make an effort, she is most definately worth taking for organic!
likes to shuffle her papers a lot and drink orange soda in the morning
What a disaster, any of you fools who think this woman is cute obviously don't care about things called grades.  I went from a C to an A in 345 with Zimmerman and an A in 344.  Do the math.

345 sucks, and Grandma B's lectures can be kinda dull, but she is kinda funny.  Her tests are rough and you have to memorize lots of reactions, but she goes by the book and presents the material in an organized manner.  She is losing her marbles but she still would be my first choice prof for Ochem.

I took her for both organic chemistry classes. She's pretty good, her notes make sense, she's pretty organized, and if you understand the lecture material and read the book to back it up you'll be just fine. but it is organic chem, and no matter what its going to be a hard class...

She basically copies the book onto the blackboard.  I skip all of her lectures- the notes are online.  Her lectures are so simplified and her exams are impossible to ace.  Her lecture pace is so slow- she needs to retire
No Comments

Her lectures are organized by outlines. She can be a little frantic. She's nice though her character has nothing to do with her teaching abilities. You just have to pay attention in lecture and you should be fine. Old exams are moderatly helpful study materials.
No Comments
psychoitcally boring

I concur...the most horrible chem professor I've ever had...thus far...and yeah..you often have to be pretty lucky to do well on her exams...they were ridiculous...i studied my rear off for this class...and stopped going to lecture about midway through the semester....guess what I still got a B...that's how worthless her lectures were...

Terrible, that's all I got to say.  She's sooooo old and slow.  Doesn't explain anything, screws up examples half the time!  Her tests?  OMG so retarted, she takes the most absurd questions just trying to trick you.  You gotta have luck and just learn it on your own, 'cuz she sure as hell doesn't explain much.

It is like going to grandmas every day.  She is a nice old lady and sounds like your grandma.  She is not to hard and takes her time to explain everything which is nice.  If you can take Grandma B she is worth it.
Slow, non-sense and poor.... She should retire
No Comments

The stuff she teaches is good, but she. is. so. SLOW. Jeez!!! She takes a full second to write each individual alphabet of every word. Coupled with the hot-as-hell lecture hall this class is held in, it's pure-freakin-torture.
A bit of an absentminded old lady.  She goes over a lot of material in detail, but doesn't do a great job of actually teaching it.
If you pay attention, you'll learn a lot and really benefit from the class. She's a really nice person.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Easy, but you don't learn anything.
